subject: Business
title: Getting to Yes: The Final Agreement
description: A short lesson to help you apply Getting to Yes: The Final Agreement.

hook.text: You've been negotiating for weeks. Both sides are close. But nobody wants to make the last move.

buildup.text: Closing a deal requires someone to propose a specific, concrete package â€” not another counteroffer.

discovery.text: Summarize all agreed points, flag remaining gaps, and propose a resolution for each gap.

twist.text: Fear of commitment stalls many closings. Both sides worry they left money on the table.

climax.text: The 'single text' method: write one draft agreement and iterate on it together rather than trading offers.

punchline.text: Somebody has to say 'Here's the deal.' Be that person.

quiz.question: What is the 'single text' closing method?
options: Writing one draft agreement and iterating on it together
Sending a single email with your final offer
Only allowing one person to speak during closing
